messages.question: Governance structure and composition
messages.answer: I’m sorry, but I can’t find the answer in the provided context.

messages.question: Governance structure and composition
messages.answer:
The highest governance body of UPS is the Board of Directors.  Key elements of its structure and composition (as of September 30, 2024) are:

1. Board of Directors  
  • 100% of directors are over 50 years old  
  • Gender: 58% male, 42% female  
  • Race/ethnicity: 25% African-American, 8% Asian-American  

2. Board Chair  
  • Held by an independent director  

3. Board Committees  
  • Audit Committee  
  • Compensation and Human Capital Committee  
  • Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee  
  • Risk Committee  
  – All four are composed entirely of independent directors (per NYSE and UPS standards)  
  • Executive Committee  
  – May exercise all Board powers except those reserved by law or expressly retained by the full Board  

4. Nomination and Independence  
  • The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews and recommends Board and committee nominees (including committee chairs) and evaluates director independence  

5. Executive Leadership Team (ELT)  
  • 22% aged 30–50; 78% over 50  
  • Gender: 67% male, 33% female  
  • Race/ethnicity: 11% African-American, 11% Asian-American  

For more detail on our governance policies, director selection process and committee charters, see the UPS Proxy Statement (“Corporate Governance,” “Our Board of Directors,” “Selecting Director Nominees,” and “Committees of the Board of Directors”).

committees, including committee chair positions. The Nominating and Corporate Governance

stakeholders. This environment is well-suited for improving organizational effectiveness, cultivating
